bill_title: revise certain provisions relating to the rights of alleged contemnors in visitation and custody matters.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions relating to the rights of alleged contemnors in visitation and custody matters. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 25-4A-3 be amended to read as follows: 25-4A-3. At the hearing, the court shall affirmatively inquire into the matters of visitation and custody and enter any orders the court deems appropriate. The alleged contemnor has the right to remain silent and the right to counsel. However, the right to counsel does not apply if the court determines, and declares in advance, that the alleged contemnor will not be subject to imprisonment, jail confinement, or other loss of liberty. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.04 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
